title: September: Compliance & Scenarios
description: Practice federal campaign compliance while managing strategic voter interactions. Simulated FEC filings affect voter approval and Candidate Coins.
readingSummary: Federal campaign compliance requires careful record-keeping and timely filings.
1. FEC Quarterly Reporting → Track contributions, expenditures, and committee information.
2. Transparency & Accuracy → Errors or omissions affect credibility, voter trust, and simulated penalties.
3. Decision-Making Under Scrutiny → Public and organizational reactions influence voter approval; choices carry consequences.

Reference Materials: [FEC Form 3 Manual (PDF)](https://www.fec.gov/resources/cms-content/documents/policy-guidance/fecfrm3.pdf), [FEC Committee Data Example](https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00588657/?cycle=2026)

tasks.prompt: Complete the FEC quarterly filing quiz reporting total contributions, expenditures, cash on hand, and committee information.
tasks.evaluation: Score ≥ 80% → +1 CC bonus; Score = 100% → +2 CC bonus. Each quiz score translates into signatures.
tasks.outcome: CC, signatures, and voter approval updated based on performance.

tasks.prompt: Scenario – Community Canvassing: Respond to a constituent who says 'I retired with $1.5M. I’m worried it won’t last.' Write a 3–5 paragraph persuasive response.
tasks.evaluation: AI assesses clarity, coherence, and alignment with campaign identity.

tasks.prompt: Scenario – Constitution Day Challenge: Protesters confront you about prior petition decisions (e.g., Gaza petition). Craft a 3–5 paragraph public response.
tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates tone, messaging consistency, and voter impact.

tasks.prompt: Scenario – Postcard Offer: Choose a distribution option and justify your decision in 1–2 paragraphs. Options: 100 CC → Full mid-October + pre-election ads; 75 CC → Late October ads only; 0 CC → Decline.
tasks.evaluation: Voter approval and visibility adjusted based on choice.

tasks.prompt: Scenario – Debate Challenge: Decide whether to accept an October debate and optionally hire a debate coach (50 CC). Explain your reasoning.
tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates strategic thinking, messaging, and CC impact.

purpose: Practice federal compliance and manage strategic voter interactions while making campaign decisions under pressure.

outcome.description: FEC filing simulated and scored → CC and signatures updated. Voter approval adjusted based on scenario responses and resource allocation. Candidate demonstrates ability to manage compliance, constituent interaction, and strategic decision-making.
